p: Diabetes mellitus (DM) is a lifelong disease characterized by the inability of the body to metabolize fat, carbohydrate, and lipid which causes hyperglycemia [ 6]. Recently, diabetes mellitus is considered a worldwide disease, for example, the number of diabetics raised from 180 million in 1980 to 422 million in 2014. In the past two years, it was a leading cause of 1.6 million death, and WHO classified it as the seventh cause of deaths [ 7â€“ 9].
